attributes.comment:
USCIS-2006-0044 - Adjustment of the Immigration Benefit Application/ Petition
and Biometric Fee Schedule

An across the board increase of approximately 66% to the already steep fees for
the processing and filing of adoption related documentation is unwarranted and un-
necessary. While it can be necessary to increase fees to provide proper or
enhanced service levels, to cover cost of living and medical coverage increase for
staff, etc., an increase of this significance is not necessary.

Reading through the proposal/justification for increase documentation, one
assumption has to be made regarding the USCIS anticipated reduction in
applications for I600/I600A:

If the USCIS assumes that FY 2008-2009 will see a decrease in submission of
these documents, is it due to the high costs of submission, prohibiting many
potential families from International Adoption?

Please reconsider the proposed rate increase and re-examine if such substantial
increases are truly necessary to support the mission of the USCIS.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Louise Clark
